inn1.comm: begins with a back-of-a-length delivery outside off, Thirimanne raises his hands out of the way as it zips through
this one swings sharply away from the left-hander and is called wide
tighter to the off stump, again some extra bounce as Thirimanne shoulders arms
Anderson slides this down the leg side, another wide
shuffles across and blocks a length ball in front of the stumps
woof, a jaffa from Anderson, dipping and scrambling away from Thirimanne off the seam, beats the groping bat
good length and leaving the batsman again, slightly wider and he stays inside the line
on leg stump, turned to midwicket with a closed bat face, loud "No!" from Thirimanne to end a probing over
begins with a wide, again some seam movement taking a length ball away from the right-hander
Gurney is bowling over the wicket, this skips up and strikes Dilshan on the thigh pad as he playas across the line
a touch straight again, this time worked off the legs, first run from the bat for SL
beaten, lovely shape on this ball, pitching and holding its line just outside off, Thirimmane fences at it
length ball on middle and off, tapped into the leg side
goes a little fuller outside off, maybe trying to tempt Thirimanne on to the drive, instead he shoulders arms again
pitched up on off stump, chops down on it and the ball rolls towards mid-on - decent start from Gurney
tip and run into the off side, Bell swoops and underarms towards the non-striker's end but Dilshan was home
slightly short of a length, blocked in front of the stumps
angled across and this nips past the bat, strikes the thigh pad and skids low to second slip
Anderson fires this across the bows and this time no stroke is offered
pitched up a little fuller outside off, Thirimanne presses forward and gently taps to mid-off
gets slightly forward to push defensively into the off side
driven on the up and that's the first boundary of the innings, Dilshan striking Gurney straight back down the ground
good response from the bowler, this climbs and surprises Dilshan a little outside off
touch too full again and rasped past mid-off this time, another flowing stroke from Dilshan
punch and counterpunch here, Gurney inducing a false stroke with a better-length delivery, goes past the outside edeg
nudges this for a single off the pads, wasn't collected cleanly
good length around off stump, Thirimanne dabs carefully into the covers
on the stumps, slightly back of a length and raps the pads as Dilshan looks to play to leg
spears this well down the leg side, that's a wide
Anderson hammering away back of a length, Dilshan sits back and guides this for a single into the gully
gets in line and defends down into the ground on the off side
dug in and climbing towards the ribs, Thirimanne rides it well and turns a single down to fine leg - he's off the mark
over the top of the stumps, blocked short on the leg side
this jags back and thumps Dilshan on the pads, Anderson strangles an appeal, the ball an inch or two high, may have come back too far as well
length delivery holding its line outside off, Thirimanne leans out to defend on the front foot
full and straight, signs of life from Thirimanne, flicking a wristy drive along the floor but picks out the fielder at mid-on
coming forward, blocks a rising delivery, thinks better about trying to steal one
bit of width on offer, Thirimanne opens the face and runs a single to third man to rotate the strike
shuffles across his stumps and nudges one off the pads
another play and a miss, though Thirimanne might say he judged this well and held his bat inside the line - just a couple off the over
back of a length and dropped short on the off side, Dilshan wanted one but Thirimanne sent him back as Bell scampered in to collect
fullish and punched back towards mid-on, not quite out of the meat but Root can only deflect it down the ground, they pick up three
tight line, comes forward to defend
plants the front foot, opens the face and steers to backward point
gets a bit more on this, guiding a length delivery down to third man - strike rate now into double figures for Thirimanne
nearly sneaks this one through Dilshan, the ball seaming back in and taking a chunk of inside edge before running to fine leg
Dilshan is being as aggressive as he can be, to compensate for Thirimanne's circumspection, throws the hands through a drive that squirms away from extra cover
bit of extra bounce from Gurney, 85mph and climbing at Thirimanne, who does well to keep it down
WALLOP!! The motor has coughed into action, Thirimanne mowing a length ball into the crowd! Lovely free swing of the arms, just his fourth scoring stroke and it sails all the way for six
Gurney, discombobulated, sprays this down the leg side
good length outside off stump, left alone
around off stump, presses forward to defends this time
touch short, in the channel, chops one more down to third man
feisty bumper from Anderson, well directed and thudding into the bat handle as Thirimanne fends it away
Thirimanne remains unruffled, pushes forward to a length ball
short again, at the body, this rises and kisses the batsman on the ribs and he tries to work it away
genuine bouncer this time, flies over Thirimanne as he crouches in the crease
comes forward to a length ball and defends

pushes and nicks to second slip, Thirimanne's vigil is over! He had been patient, oh so patient, but England were working him hard, this he could have left, slightly back of a length and in the channel but the hands were drawn to it and a lick of flame singed the outside edge, sizeable deflection and a safe take from Tredwell
length ball that nibbles back, defended from the crease
full and down the leg side, Dilshan flicks and misses, deflects off the pad through to Buttler
straight line and flicked around the corner for a single
good length and in the channel outside off, lets the ball through
touch short and over the top of off, Sangakkara taps gently down on to the pitch, not one there
length and worked off the hips straight to square leg
slightly full delivery on the stumps, pushed wide of mid-on for one
too straight to Sanga, who nurdles one off his pads to get his innings up and running
banged in short, Dilshan rolls through a pull but fails to connect
going on with the arm towards middle and leg, flicked through midwicket for one more
slightly full, driven firmly on the up but straight to mid-off
pushed through outside off stump, Sangakkara raises the bat out of harm's way
on the stumps, defended from the crease
tight on off stump, Dilshan leans out and dabs the ball to midwicket, just a roll of the wrists
in the corridor outside off, good pace and carry, left alone by Sangakkara
tight lines and Sanga goes for the dab and run, fine of mid-off where Anderson dives and underarms just past the stumps. Would have been very close if that had hit
Dilshan turns a length ball off the straight behind square on the leg side
slides down the leg side - that'll be wide
pitched up on middle and leg, clipped to mid-on coming forwards
on the stumps, Dilshan glances through square leg for one
Sangakkara makes a premeditated move down the pitch and although he doesn't connect with a flick off his legs, a deflection off the pads takes the ball past Buttler and beats fine leg to the boundary
comes forward again, elegant clip past midwicket for a single into the deep
full and outside off, Dilshan cloths a drive into the covers
outside the line of off, Dilshan carves the ball past cover with an energetic drive on the up
pitched up and worked for one more wide of mid-on
in the channel, a touch on the full side and gently punched towards mid-off
length delivery, Sanga waits on it and chops into the ground square on the off side
good length outside off, no stroke offered this time
overpitched and there's enough width for Sangakkara to unfurl a gorgeous cover drive - that's Sri Lanka's first boundary since Thirimanne's six in the eighth over
digs this in short at the batsman, who gets out of the way
another bumper, leg side but it takes some glove or bat as Sangakkara raises his hands out of the way and bounces through to Buttler
slightly short from Bopara, pulled from outside off through deep backward square, doesn't quite have the pace to beat two fielders converging on it
full and wide, maybe a slower delivery, Dilshan fails to get the bat down on it
bit of width outside off, again Dilshan swishes and misses
gets on the front foot and pushes to mid-off, who is set back enough for there to be a comfortable single
fuller and slightly wide of the stumps, Sangakkara lets it through
easy medium pace from Bopara, mid-70s and nibbling away outside off, another leave from Sanga
on the stumps, closes the bat face and works one to leg
a mix up nearly see Sangakkara run out! He was halfway down the pitch when he realised Dilshan wasn't coming but Carberry's throw from point was wide
edges forward and dabs defensively into the off side
drops a little short, Sanga rolls the wrists on a pull to deep backward square
short again from Jordan but Dilshan is well in control of this, uses the pace well and swats four through deep backward square, too good for the boundary rider
better length outside off, Dilshan shows this a studied forward defensive
around the wicket, length on off stump, played late and cut in front of point for a single
tossed up and flicked with the spin through midwicket for another single
straightening outside off, tapped short into the covers
beats the bat, little bit of turn for Tredwell and the ball thuds into Buttler's gloves as Sanga pushes unsuccessfully
takes the outside edge but wide of slip! Tredwell is tossing it up nice and slow, Sangakkara prods forward and gets a thick edge that goes quickly to ground and runs away for a couple
tight lines from Tredders, defended coming forwards
shortish and wide, Dilshan throws his everything into a cut and clean misses
fuller, a little wide. Dilshan drives at it and gets it as far as short cover
fullish, on the pads. Whips it to short midwicket
yorker, gets his toes out of the way and digs it out back to the bowler
full ball, tight into the stumps. Dilshan drives it back to Bopara
spoils the maiden with length on the pads, Dilshan turns it away square of short midwicket for a brace
tossed up outside off, Sangakkara advances and basically pads it away
tossed up on off stump, Sangakkara leans forward and pushes, but it catches an inside edge and squirts away to the legside infield. Gets it into a space.
length outside off, turns sharply in at Dilshan who bunts it back to the bowler
fullish on the legs, turned to short fine leg for a single
looped up outside off, Sanga drives to long on
plenty of air again, on the stumps, turning in. Dilshan clips it to deep midwicket
full on the stumps, driven past the bowler, but can't beat mid on
full on off stump again, Sanga drives. Doesn't time it that well, but there's enough time to get a single to mid off
length on the pads, turned away to deep square leg
Sanga shuffles down the pitch. Bopara sees him coming and digs it in short of a length. Sanga just bunts it and there's no single
short of a length outside off stump, defended. Ball dribbles just off the pitch
shortish and wide, Sanga leans into a nice cut, which beats backward point, but can't beat the sweeper. The two fielders on the fence makes a mess of it though, and the batsmen take three
floated up outside off, defended
Tredwell's giving it plenty of air. Again looped up on off, this is driven to long off
slow and flighted outside off, Dilshan steps forward and defends
dances down the pitch this time and drives straight back, where Tredwell makes a smart stop
comes down the pitch again, once more he hits straight, and Tredwell again collects
ooh, that's the quicker one. Pitched outside off on a length and stayed low. Dilshan tries to cut but gets a thick under edge. No run.
fullish again, driven wide enough of mid off to allow a single
short of a length on off stump, defended
Dilshan's having no luck with that straight drive. Full again, punches straight back to Bopara, who collects it with a skip
full again, driven to mid off for one

cut, but not with full control. That was short and wide, Sanga went at it and hit it with the top part of the bat. It loops wide of Carberry at backward point though, and as fine leg fields, the batsmen come back for a tight two
Sanga shuffles down again, and Bopara pulls back his length and fires it wide. The batsman ends up just leaving it alone.
tossed up outside off stump, Dilshan skips down and pushes to long on
slow, but a little shorter this time. Sanga steps back and punches square on the offside for one
a little shorter again, and tossed up wide. Dilshan slinks forward, then back, and cuts it in front of square, where it evades the fielders and rolls to the fence
length on the legs, turned square for a single
shuffling down has finally worked for Sanga, He picks this up about a metre and a half out of the pitch and lofts it over mid on for four
ooh a little turn for Tredwell. This pitches on a length on off stump and spins away. Sanga pokes at it and the thick outside edge falls well away from slip
length on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
length on middle stump, driven back again. Tidied up by mid on
short of a length on off stump, punched to the offside sweeper for a single
Sanga cuts at a slightly wide one, but it's not as short as he anticipated and it's mistimed
full on the toes, whipped away to that legside sweeper
length ball on off stump, heaved away to deep midwicket for a single
Dilshan is down the pitch to Tredders this time, and he completes his fifty  as he clips this to deep midwicket. Raises his bat to the dressing room
fullish on the pads, worked away to the leg side
down the track again, and hits an identical shot to get it to deep midwicket
length on the pads, Sanga slides back and gets this in the space behind square on the legside
faster and flatter on the pads, pushed away to the vacant legside, square of the wicket
he's advanced again and tries to muscle this over the ring, but doesn't quite time it. Lands safely enough though, and long off comes around to cut it off
Oho! The Dilscoop makes its first appearance. A sign DIlshan is starting to flow here. Full on off stump, Dilshan gets low and sends this over the shoulder, very fine and no fielders even had a hope
full on off stump, jammed out to mid off
full and dug out by Sanga, but straight to mid on
fullish again, hit wide enough of mid off to get a single
Bopara keeps pitching it full. Dilshan pushes hard at that, but doesn't get it past short cover
another floater on the stumps, driven to long on for a single
Tredwell tosses it up again. Dilshan is forward in a flash, driving down to long on
pulls the length back a bit, but he's still bowling very slow. Gets a nice forward defence from the batsman
fullish on the pads, worked away towards deep midwicket
length on the pads, that's clipped wide of short midwicket for a single
quick, shortish and wide. Sanga cuts hard, but straight to backward point
slow, tossed up outside off, turning away. Sanga just pushes it gently to the offside
shortish ball on the body, Dilshan rocks back smartly and thwacks it to deep square leg
this one is sharp, and at Sanga's ribs. Hits the chest pad and deflects on to the off side. No room for a leg bye
little too straight, as he attempts another short one. Sanga glances off his thigh tot fine leg
short, about a foot wide of off stump, Dilshan leans back and cuts it to deep point
slower one I think, and it sure fools Sanga. This is pitched about halfway down the pitch and Sanga moves to pull, before realising he's too early through the shot. Ball hits him on the side
shortish again, at the body. Tucked to leg for a single
tossed up on the pads, Sanga skips down and drives forcefully to long on
tossed up again, Dilshan's out of his crease as well, but middles it to long on, along the ground
Tredders pulls the length back and Sanga waits on the back foot. Cuts it away to the offside sweeper
shortish, turning in. Dilshan backs away to make room for the cut, but can't get much power into it
length ball, Dilshan's down the track easing it to long on
fullish ball, Sanga hangs back and tries to cut, but again there's not enough room. Squeezes it to backward point
length outside off, Dilshan opens the face and gets it behind point, setting off immediately for a couple, which he safely completes
outside off, but this one's shorter and there's a bit of extra zip. Passes well over Dilshan's cut shot
fullish on the stumps, Dilshan pushes it wide of mid on for one
short and wide, Sanga throws his bat at it, but misses
short and wide again, Sanga cuts again, but it's a bit too wide and he misses. Umpire calls it
length on the stumps, Sanga defends to leg
short, just outside off. Sanga leans back and hooks, but mistimes it and sends it along the ground to midwicket. They go through for a run, and there's a shy at the stumps, but think he was safe
tossed up on off, turning away. Pushed straight to cover
length ball, slow again, turning. Sanga gets on the back foot and beats cover this time, with a punch
tossed up on the stumps, Dilshan is forward again, using that productive drive to long on

beautifully slow delivery from Tredwell and Sanga goes, trying to force it over the leg side. This is pitched outside off, turning away, and Sanga gets on his kneees and tries to slog it against the turn. The result is a top edge that goes almost straight up. Jos Buttler calls for it, settles nicely beneath it and pouches the ball. Good breakthrough. Tredwell deserves it for his bravery.
fullish outside off stump, Mahela uses his wrists and tries to get it through the legside with the spin, but can't beat short cover who makes a diving stop
tossed up on the stumps, Mahela turns it to short cover
full and wide, Dilshan throws his bat at it, but doesn't time it well. Gets it as far as mid off
length outside off stump, Mahela defends again
length on the stumps, defended to the off side.
full outside off, Anderson's looking for movement. Mahela blocks it into the off side
short of a length on the stumps, Mahela bunts this and it dribbles square on the legside, into space
length on the pads, turned square on the legside towards the deep fielder
tossed up outside off, Dilshan's down the track, hitting down to long off
pitched up wide of off stump, Mahela tries to get across and work it to leg, but he can't beat short midwicket
pitched up outside off again, Mahela tries the paddle sweep this time and gets it fine of short fine leg
darted in on off stump, Dilshan defends to off

slightly quicker again, but shorter and wider. Dilshan cuts it away behind square and Ballance hares after it, pulling it in nicely and letting fly with the throw. But what's this? It might be a run out. Mahela's coming back for the third and England may have caught him short. I think there was a bit of complacency there from Mahela, who didn't bother diving. England weren't that excited about it, but he's at least a few inches out. Double blow for Sri Lanka.
pitched up full outside off, Mathews leans out and works this toward long on to get off the mark
Short of a length outside off, defended solidly
length ball, but he sprays this down the legside
full on the stumps, Mathews gets a thick inside edge and this squirts out to deep square leg
fullish ball, pushed straight to deep cover
fullishe again, pushed into the off side
Bopara's too slow for that length. Pitches it short at the body. Dilshan rocks back and murders it behind square on the leg side.
length on off stump, Dilshan pushes wide of mid on and scampers one
starts around the wicket, tossed up outside leg stump and swept to the man on the edge of the ring
pushed through a little flatter outside off and blocked
slightly short and there's room to swing the arms but he slaps a cut straight to point
shouts of "catch!" as the batsman pops the ball in the air through midwicket, it lands safely
floated up on the stumps, tapped into the leg side
this slips out of Root's hand, becoming a full toss outside leg stump, tries to swing it away and only succeeds in sliding it off the face along the ground to short fine leg
on the stumps and flicked through backward square
slings an errant delivery down the leg side
Jordan begins to appeal then realises there was a thin inside edge before the ball struck Mathews on the pads
length ball and this stays a bit low, closes the face and turns one through midwicket
length outside off and Dilshan chops it into the covers coming forwards, sets off immediately and dives to make sure of his ground, even though Bopara's throw misses
drops short, sits up nicely to be pulled but Mathews sends it on to the bounce to fine leg for one - 150 up for Sri Lanka
wide on the crease and sprays another down the leg side - England's 19th of the innings
on the stumps now, Dilshan pushes a single short of midwicket
over the wicket, slightly back of a length outside off, dabbed into the covers
short ball and pulled fiercely behind square, where Ian Bell scampers after it and pulls off a sliding, one-handed stop to prevent a boundary in the deep. Super work
another bumper from Gurney, over off stump and uppercut for four by Dilshan, powerfully ramped wide of third man, who can't cut it off
straighter line and clipped off the pads through square for a single
pushes defensively into the covers
short again, this time Mathews tries to pull but strikes the ball awkwardly and it rolls to midwicket

bowled him, through the gate, Dilshan goes! He was closing in on a first hundred in England, had mixed care with aggression but he's been done by a perfect length from Jordan, lured him forward and the ball tailed in between bat and pad, thunking into the top of middle to ping the bails. Slightly loose from Dilshan but Jordan has done really well to fox a man who's hung in there for 100 deliveries
shortish ball on the stumps, goes across and defends calmly
straight line and this time Priyanjan works it into a gap on the leg side
good pace from Jordan but Mathews uses the pace to his own ends to flick behind square
pitched up outside off, gets forward and pushes to cover
slightly full and again punched into the covers - another dot, good bowling from Jordan, the initiative back with England
angled across the left-hander, takes a thick outside edge but loops through a vacant area of the field
stays in the crease and runs one to third man
skips down and tries to hit over cover, misjudges the pace but gets a single off the inside half of the bat
length ball, goes back and across and defends
down the leg side, another freebie from England
lovely delivery from Gurney, decks away from Priyanjan and past the outside edge
gets forward and works a single wide of mid-on
fullish length outside off, Priyanjan punches the ball straight to point
good, teasing line from Jordan, Priyanjan flails wildly and misses
goes forward and pings a drive into the covers, a misfield gives the the batsman two

Jordan touches 90mph as Priyanjan skies a top edge down to third man... but Gurney drops it, couldn't quite hold on as he dived forwards, the ball went in and then slipped out of his grasp as he hit the ground. Did well to get down but should really have held it having got there
around the line of off, Mathews gets in liune
a beaut from Jordan, holds its line and zips through as Mathews feels for it
on the stumps, flicks one through midwicket
tossed up and worked off the stumps for another single to the leg side
floated up and Priyanjan skips out to go downtown, sweetly struck down the ground and it has landed right on the edge of the boundary marker, given as six after a bit of deliberation. Top bombing
comes forward and works the ball in more sedate fashion to long-on
Mathews pushes another single down the ground

tossed up and Priyanjan collars Tredwell again, this is a mighty boosh over the rope between long-on and deep midwicket, no doubt this time - those were Priyanjan's first two sixes in international cricket and they've dented Tredwell's figures slightly
shortish, pulls hard and bottom edges a single through midwicket
fullish on off stump, driven powerfully back and Bopara gets a hand on it, rolls slowly to mid-off
bit of width, attempts to cut but can't get it through
uses the feet well again, scoops a mistimed thump down the ground for one to long-on
punched for a single to long-off
slower ball, wide of the stumps and pulled flat down the ground for one more to long-on
back of a length outside off, goes back and opens the face for one to third man
Mathews backs away but Anderson follows him at the last second, manages to deflect it square
pacy bouncer, too quick for Priyanjan, who swings across the line and misses
on middle and leg, length delivery and neatly flicked over the ring for a couple between the fielders in the deep
Priyanjan backs away and Anderson takes it too far this time, sending down a wide
pitched up right in the blockhole, dug out to mid-on for one
pitched up full and straight, squeezes the ball through midwicket for another single
slightly too full, Mathews clubs it down the ground and that's a safe shot with mid-on up, runs away for four
Jordan goes short, flies through very high but England get away with not conceding a wide this time
full and straight and worked off the toes for a couple through the leg side
Mathews steps to leg, Jordan follows him, called this time
makes room again, full and at the pads, chipped over the bowler but short of mid-off, the throw hits but Mathews was home
goes short and Priyanjan scuffs a pull shot into the ground through midwicket
the extra ball hurts Jordan, cannily done by Mathews, backing away and deflecting a short ball to undefended third man
on the stumps, stays back and works it with the angle into a gap on the leg side
another short ball, rolls his wrists on a pull to fine leg
Mathews swats ineffectively at a bouncer, well-directed from Anderson and flew past the shoulder

pulled lazily into the deep, no control... but it's dropped by Bopara, a really dolly, through the hands he came in from deep square leg! Nearly caught it between his thighs but that was a real Horlicks of an effort, Bopara right to look disgusted with himself
pulls a short ball round the corner to fine leg
comes forward and punches one through the covers
pitched up outside leg stump, Mathews does well to squeeze it away for a couple
Mathews makes room again, Jordan goes full and manages to slip this one under the bat
length ball around off stump, punched to cover off the back foot, Bell's throw is well wide though
smart work from Priyanjan, four more to third man, cheeky little reverse ramp to take a full ball from outside leg stump in the other direction
low full toss again, this time punched into the covers
too short, Mathews doesn't bother playing at it - 14th wide of the innings, and Jordan's fifth
full this time, Mathews gets an inside edge on to his pads, Jordan follows through but can't prevent them getting one
slower ball, around off stump, thumped out of the middle by Mathews but straight to point along the ground

throws the bat again, this time picking out cover with a mistimed drive! May have been another change of pace, Gurney was bowling around the wicket and Mathews wanted to go inside out over cover, didn't get enough on it and this time a simple catch is taken simply
full and straight and nurdled into the leg side
slow chinaman legbreak from Gurney, this spins back in from wide of the guidelines... but not enough for umpire Erasmus' liking
full toss outside off, sliced over the infield and this has the legs to beat Ballance, four more for Priyanjan

skips out and carves the ball over point this time, deliberately hit on the up and it looks like being four more until Carberry, charging like an Olympic sprinter in its wake, drags it in right on the rope
takes the pace off, Chandimal chops into the ground behind square
short of a length, pulls via the thigh pad for one to fine leg

slower-ball bouncer and Priyanjan top-edges to mid-on! Been a fiesty little knock but he was duped there, through the shot a little early trying to drag a pull over midwicket, it looped up softly to Morgan, who pockets it nonchalantly. That's Anderson's 250th ODI wicket and England will hope it finally puts the brakes on the SL innings
short again, pulled to fine leg on the bounce and the throw would have had Chandimal struggling but for a low bounce that meant Buttler couldn't collect
bosh, that's right out of the screws! Chandimal whirls his arms through a flat scud of a pull through deep square, no chance for the fielders on either side
down the leg side, just a snick on it and Buttler does well to stop it from flying past him
bouncer to finish the over, seemed to go well above Kulasekara's head but not called wide
slower ball, outside off and Chandimal picks it, lashing a drive wide of mid-off, no stopping that
Gurney rolls this out the back of the hand again, nearly succeeds in having Chandimal pop it straight back to him
pitched up and slapped to cover! Not enough elevation as Chandimal looked for the ropes again, skewered his drive straight to Bopara, who takes his second catch to help atone for dropping Mathews
another slower delivery, manages to deflect it behind square
Kulasekara clears the front leg and clouts the ball high towards cow corner... but there's a man out there and he's gone too! Third wicket for Gurney, Sri Lanka stumbling towards 250
full toss, whipped off the pads through midwicket
manages to squirt the ball into the leg side, a direct hit at the non-striker's end would have run out Senanayake but instead SL bring up the 250
hacks across the line and gets a top edge short of midwicket, drops safely though
backs away and Jordan fires this in full and straight, dug out for a single square on the off side
pitched up on the stumps, goes across and deflects it through backward square, they run hard for two more
shorter length, blocked to the on side, Jordan sweeps up to prevent a run
almost yorker length on off stump, swings hard and gets an outside edge to point, they scrape one more, finishing the innings on 256 for 8

inn2.comm: goes full, looking for swing, but it's not there, and it's easy picking for Carberry. Pushes this off the pads past midwicket, and they run well enough to collect 3
nothing off the pitch again. Kulasekara pushes this short and wide, Bell settles quickly on the back foot and thwacks it past point for four
full toss, close into the stumps. Bell checks his drive and sends it to mid off
fullish, outside off. Bell watches it through
little bit of seam back into the batsman there. Length on the stumps, Bell gets inside the line, knocks it into the legside and scampers through
this is pushed teasingly full, just outside off. Carberry leaves it alone
a little bit of away swing as he pitches this one up to Bell. The batsman just pushes it back

some away swing again, and Bell gets a thick edge to this length ball on the stumps. He uses soft hands though, and it lands well in front of second slip who misfields, and allows the batsmen to take two
short of a length outside off, curling away ever so gently. Bell things about pushing at it but decides against it
a bit of width, and Bell gets on the back foot and punches this nicely between cover and point. Fielder gives chase and reels it in at the rope, but the batsmen take three
not a bad ball first up. In-swinging low full toss for Carberry, who keeps it out solidly. He's overstepped though, and this is a free hit
sits back in the crease and carves a length ball on the stumps past mid off. A little dilly-dallying in the field allows a third
full, a little wide, swinging away. Bell leaves.
beats the edge with a back of a length ball that pitches on leg and moves across Carberry
this strikes Carberry on the pads in front of leg stump, but that's pitched way outside leg. Muted appeal turned down. A couple of leg byes to fine leg
length on the stumps, punched crisply to cover

gone! Carberry's stay is a short one. Classic Kulasekara dismissal of a left-hander. Pitches it on middle and off, wobbles it away. Carberry gets a thin but audible edge as he prods on the front foot, and Sangakkara collects at around knee height. Sri Lanka have their first.
length on the stumps, pushed to mid on
length on off stump, Ballance pushes defensively and gets a thick edge that squirts out to point
length on the stumps, Bell pushes back respectfully
length on the stumps again, Bell just happy to defend
straight through him! This is floated up beautifully, it dips late and swings just a little as well. Bell drives straight, but it's past his inside edge and misses the stumps by a matter of inches
length ball outside off stump. Bell just pushes to the off side
length on off stump again, but the batsman steps across and turns it into the legside, where there is a space in the infield.
this is floated up, but there's no swing or dip. Ballance just leans into a cover drive and smokes the full toss through the covers to get himself out of the blocks.
length outside off stump, Bell gets forward and opens the face, squeezing it out towards third man
Kulasekara is yet to find his radar this tour. This one is on the legs, Ballance tries to work it square and misses. It falls into space though, and a leg bye is taken
length ball, tight on the stumps. Bell defends confidently

nice use of the variation from Kulasekara. This is the one that straightens down the line a tad. It doesn't do a lot, but Bell is expecting this wide, back of a length ball to seam in as they usually do, and ends up giving a thick edge to Sangakkara. Kula hasn't got his lines right, but he's got two nonetheless.
length ball, outside off stump, seaming in. Root leaves alone
this is tighter in to the stumps, length again. Root is forward to block
back of a length on the body. Ballance works it off his hips to fine leg

OH! And that's completely done Root in. The batsman misjudges the length completely, stays back to a length ball he could have come forward to, and what's more, played down the wrong line to a ball that seamed away. Root plays too straight and Malinga cleans up the off stump. England in a state early on.
length outside off stump, he punches this through the covers for a couple
fullish outside off stump, Ballance watches it skid through
fullish and closer to off stump now, Ballance is on the front foot, blocking
this is a lifter on the body, Morgan gets out of the way smartly.
length on off stump, Ballance just defends it

another one for Kulasekara, and I think this is the one that straightens again. This is angled across Ballance, who expects it to jag away when it pitches on a length, but it seams the other way - not a lot, but enough to beat the bat and strike the front pad. That would have gone on to hit off stump. The umpire raises his finger. Ballance doesn't bother reviewing. Seam has got the England top order in tatters
Full outside off stump, Bopara leans forward to defend
full outside off again, seaming in slightly. Bopara is forward to defend again
length on the legs, just pushed gently into the legside infield
full, angling in, a little seam. Bopara lets it go
length, a little wide. Morgan's cut goes straight to backward point
short and at the body, tucks Morgan up and it hits him on the chest pad, I think
another short one at the chest, but this time Morgan is ready for it and deadbats it from high up
length outside off, trying to tease Morgan into a drive, but he leaves it alone
more short-of-a-length stuff, Morgan sways out of the way of this as it passes just outside off
length on the stumps there, and Morgan's solid defence completes the maiden
length on off stump, seaming in. Bopara leans forward and defends
bouncer, but not well directed. This goes wide of off stump and Bopara watches it fly past his nose
Length just outside off, seaming in. Bopara lets it go through.
big shout, but that is heading down leg. Pitches about middle and seams in toward the legs. Hits Bopara just in line with leg.
ooh good ball, this pitches outside off and beats the inside edge, as it seams in. But it hits Bopara too high on the back leg
more of the same, inducker from a length. Bopara manages a thick inside edge onto pads this time
Length outside off stump, Morgan tries to cut, but it's too close to the stumps and he chops it down near his feet
nice channel from Prasad. Full length, moving slightly away off the seam. Morgan lets it through
Morgan has a flash at this. Wideish and short, angling across. He tries to larrup this over the infield, but clean misses
length ball on off stump, pushed firmly into the offside infield
and a wide down legside spoils the string of maidens
shortish and wide, Morgan connects with the cut this time, but it's straight to fine leg
short of a length, at the body. Bopara tucks this to leg, but straight to midwicket
shortish and a little wide. Morgan cuts it, but straight to gully
length ball, Morgan tries to drive on the up, but his outside edge can't beat a diving Dilshan at backward point
full and on off stump, Morgan drives this wide enough of mid off to finally sneak a run off Kulasekara
wide length ball, Bopara punches this nicely in front of square on the offside, but though it pierces the gap, Dilshan tears after it and reels it in at the rope
length on off stump, pushed away into the infield
length on off stump again, and Morgan uses those powerful wrists to chop down on it hard enough to beat backward point. It's wide of fine leg too, so they get two
lovely shape on this one, as angles it in to Bopara, pitches it on a length and then wobbles it away as the batsman prods.
angle in, shape away again, but this is on off stump and Bopara is wise to it, offering a solid defence
but this one is short and wide, and Bopara cracks that away off the back foot through point, it takes less than two seconds to get to the fence
full and on the toes, dug out with a lot of inside edge
angled in on off stump, Bopara stays in his crease and defends that length ball
angled in on the stumps, Bopara whips this straight on the legside, where it is quickly collected
flighted up on off stump and straightens. Morgan just pushes it away
straightening on about off stump. Morgan works it to leg this time, but not with much intent
spinning away after pitching on off, Morgan defends
tries the reverse sweep to that fullish delivery, but doesn't really connect. It hits Sanga's shoe and there's no run
full on off stump, Morgan drives it towards long off, but short cover cuts it off smartly
flatter and faster, punched down to long off
length ball outside off, Morgan pushes to the off side
short ball, outside off and Morgan climbs imperiously into a pull sending it clattering into the boundary boards at around deep midwicket
full outside off stump, Morgan gives it safe passage
fullish on the stumps, Morgan steps forward and defends
length outside off stump, Morgan unambitiously pushes into the off side
full, tempting ball outside off stump, straightening just a tad. Morgan watches it through.
flat and full on the stumps, Bopara blocks it back to the bowler
shorter and slower, Bopara turns it square on the leg side but it's straight to square leg
full and flighted, driven powerfully to short cover
turn and bounce there. Sachi pitches outside off and spins it in, gets bounce enough to rap Bopara on the gloves
turning in sharply from outside off again, pushed into the legside

bowled him! Completely foxes him in the flight, Bopara pushes at this one, as it pitches outside off. Doesn't account for the turn or the bounce that Senanayake gets, and the ball beats the inside edge and strikes off stump. England in further disarray. Think that was the one that moves off the seam. Bopara was caught in two minds whether to come forward or back.
full outside off stump, Morgan unwinds a nice looking off drive, but can't beat mid off
wide down the legside
shortish outside off stump, dragged to midwicket
short ball on the body, Buttler climbs up and deadbats this onto the pitch
lovely, languid shot. This is full and wide, Buttler leans forward and unfurls a sumptuous square drive that beats the infield and screams away for four
short of a length on the body, defended
bouncer, which is good on line, but it's a little too short. Over the head, given a wide.
shortish outside off stump, Buttler chops at it and gets an under edge that bounces off to short cover
looped up slow and wide, turning away from Morgan who leaves alone
flighted, and even slower, Morgan drives at it and gets it to short cover
another loopy slow delivery, Morgan tries to scoop but misses it I think
tossed up on off stump, defended
tossed up again, but a little fuller this time. Morgan deadbats it
flighted, but this is a little straight, and Morgan laps it around the corner for a couple

Oh geez, what's happened there? That one looks like it stopped on Buttler, but Mathews does do that sometimes. It's a fairly average ball otherwise, and Buttler will be annoyed by that. It's short of a length, about a foot outside off. The batsman looks to drag it to leg, but is fooled by the lack of pace. In the end, all he does is bunt it up gently in the air to the off side, where Senanayake at short cover dives to his side and snaffles it.
bouncer first up, Jordan sways out of the way and lets it through.
short again, but this seems to be a wide on height. Jordan let it through.
short of a length again, pulled hard to deep midwicket for a single
Mathews keeps pitching short, but Morgan latches onto this one, which is just outside off. It flies towards deep midwicket where Chandimal attempts to cut it off, but fails
length ball this time, outside off. Morgan lets it through.
short of a length outside off, this is cut away late to third man
full, played from the crease down to long-on

sharp offspin, Jordan caught on the crease and given out lbw was it doing too much? Jordan goes for the review. He's right back on the stumps and hit in line with middle and Hawk Eye has it smashing leg stump so a second good decision from umpire Erasmus in the innings and England slide further. He can biff the seamers but a different kettle of fish against spin for Jordan
around the wicket, forward and dabbed into the covers
another lbw appeal with Tredwell forward on middle and leg but that would have slid down
forward again playing into the covers
more air on this, forward defence yet again
around the wicket, full on off stump, driven down to long-off
fuller and nudged down to long-off
little short and Morgan is quickly back to pull wide of deep midwicket
full on the stumps, tucked back to the bowler
length ball blocked around off stumps, runs to point
wider on the crease, tucked with the angle to short long leg
over the wicket, forward and pressed to cover point
more air, more carefully defended around off stump
two slips and a leg slip, wide enough outside off to leave alone
forward and runs this to second slip from off stump
around the wicket, a touch short and Tredwell slashes it hard past the slips for a couple towards third man
a foot outside off, well left alone
straight line on a full length, knocked to midwicket
length on the stumps, blocked in the crease
waited for just outside off and guided wide of third man but still no chance of the second
off stump line on a length, blocked in the crease
down the wicket and slaps a length ball without timing to extra cover
cut hard on the back foot to backward point

tossed up just outside off and Tredwell lifts it up and down the ground and straight into the hands of long-off. What a funny shot. I assumed it was a calm chip for a couple over the in-field but Tredwell has just knocked it nicely to the fielder coming in a few yards. Bizarre. Terrible stroke
slog swept from off stump, mistimed to deep square
forward and left alone outside off stump
back, ill-advisedly, and just gets it away from off stump into the covers
straighter line and fuller, swept off the stumps backward of deep square
flat delivery wide of off stump, left alone
full and straight, driven back to the bowler who fumbles before mid-on cleans up
touch more leg side and clipped for a single through midwicket
back of a length and tucked to square leg
touch shorter and whistles past Anderson's shoulder, he just about got the bat inside the line
short again, this at the body, fended off awarkdly down to long leg
full length angled across Morgan who drives beautifully up and over mid-off and he's nailed it all the way for six, superb timing and England now might avoid their lowest score
reverse swept from just outside off, audacious from Anderson, he missed
pushed on the back foot back to the bowler
waited for and cut from just outside off to cover point
full delivery, goes reverse again and this time creams it backward of point, top timing
forward blocked on the stumps
forward just blocking once again
bumper, pulled, wild top edge and it flies all the way for six over long leg and England do indeed avoid their lowest ODI total
full and wide down leg

back of a length, pulled hard, good timing but Morgan has perfectly picked out deep midwicket who holds a solid catch. Morgan was understandably swinging at anything in his zone and he made a great connection but couldn't keep it down or indeed get the direction right
back of a length on the stumps, Gurney steps inside it and allows it to pass
short again, Gurney this time swings and misses
another swing and miss, this time sort of aiming leg side to a similar ball
a step to leg, the bowler follows the batsman who tries an awkward pull and gets a thick bottom edge that runs wide of the diving Sangakkara

a charge down the wicket, wild swing having got nowhere near the pitch of the ball and Anderson is bowled and England have been routed here. A pretty ugly ending with a miserable shot from Anderson to lose his off stump. Completes an excellent spell from Senanayake, his fourth wicket
